thread.title: Petition to save Neighbours and keep it on British TV reaches 8,500 signatures
thread.title_full: Petition to save Neighbours and keep it on British TV reaches 8,500 signatures

author: Janine Yaqoob
title: Petition to save Neighbours and keep it on British TV reaches 8,500 signatures
text:
TV Petition to save Neighbours and keep it on British TV reaches 8,500 signatures The Aussie soap is said to be in danger of being axed over stalling talks between producers and Channel 5 Share Neighbours could be axed from British TV (Photo: Channel 5) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Neighbours fans have reacted passionately to the possibility of the soap being axed from British TV - with over 8,500 people signing a petition to keep it on air. 
Viewers have been left devastated after talks between producers and broadcaster Channel 5 reportedly stalled, leaving the future of the long-running show - which first aired in the UK in 1986 - in doubt. 
Now, a petition set up online has gathered huge support, with more than 8,500 fans signing, bringing it closer to its 10,000 target. The petition is gathering support (Photo: change.org) 
The page reads: "It is a huge part of British culture and has a massive UK followers! 
"We, the fans, are petitioning to Channel 5 and Fremantle Group to keep Neighbours on our screens!! (sic)" 
TV insiders claim talks between Channel 5 and makers FremantleMedia to renegotiate a deal have stalled. 
If an agreement can’t be reached then Neighbours could move to another channel or there is a real risk it could disappear from British screens completely. Charlene, played by Kylie, and Scott, played by Donovan, married in Neighbours (Photo: channel 5) 
A source said: “The renegotiation of the Neighbours Channel 5 deal has become very fraught and is in jeopardy. Channel 5 really want to keep the show. 
“But the failure to reach a deal is being blamed on Channel 5’s new American owners Viacom refusing to sign off on the figures and not understanding the cultural importance of the show in the UK. Read More Great British Bake Off bosses 'clash over Noel Fielding signing due to comedian's controversial past' 
“Neighbours has become a British TV favourite and it would be a sad day if it were to go.” 
Neighbours has remained popular with UK viewers and is known for catapulting Kylie Minogue and Jason Donovan to global fame. 
The show, regarded as Australia’s greatest soap export, celebrated its 30th anniversary in 2015. Ramsey Street (Photo: Rex Features) Read More 
The series follows the residents of Ramsay Street including Kylie and Jason’s characters iconic characters Charlene and Scott. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
